metadata.title: CVE-2022-48665 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: exfat:fix overflow for large capacity partition Using int type for sector index,there will be overflow in a large capacity partition. For example, ifstorage with sector size of 512 bytes and partition capacity is larger than2TB, there will be overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
